newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares close higher, small-caps lead.
newsitem.headline: KL shares close higher, small-caps lead.

text.p: Kuala Lumpur shares closed higher with small-capitalised stocks maintaining their upward momentum following return of retail investors from festive holidays, dealers said.

But larger-capitalisation issues struggled to stay in positive territory as institutions locked in profits from last week's run-up. "Profit-taking was evident throughout the day though selling was not heavy,' said an institutional dealer.
At the close, the Composite Index of 100 large-capitalised stocks was up 5.57 points at 1,252.48. The small-capitalised Second Board index rose 14.79 points or 2.36 percent to 642.61.
Market volume totalled 517 million shares, with gainers outnumbering losers 442 to 202.
An analyst said near-term prospects for the market remain positive, pegging immediate support for the Composite Index at 1,240.

Berjaya Industrial topped the actives' list, rising 16 cents to 3.88 ringgit on volume of 29 million shares. Sum Cheong International of Hong Kong said on Monday it bought a 2.95 percent stake in Berjaya Industrial.
Second boarders Anakku Corp, Hwai Tai Food, Lityan and Union Paper gained between 2.00 and 3.25 ringgit.
